item.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 151.
Reported adversely by the Committee on Armed Services. H. Rept. 109-384.
Reported adversely by the Committee on Armed Services. H. Rept. 109-384.
Ordered to be Reported Adversely by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Strategic Forces.
Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.

summary.text: Requests the President and directs the Secretary of Defense to transmit to the House of Representatives all documents in their possession relating to: (1) the scope of activities undertaken by the Department of Defense (DOD), the Counterintelligence Field Activity, or related agencies with regard to the Threat and Local Observation Notice reports; and (2) the legal authority serving as the basis for the National Security Agency (NSA) or DOD to conduct surveillance and gather counterterrorism intelligence within the United States without warrants.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary has been expanded because action occurred on the measure.)

Requests the President and directs the Secretary of Defense, within 14 days after the adoption of this resolution, to transmit to the House of Representatives all documents in their possession relating to: (1) the scope of activities undertaken by the Department of Defense (DOD), the Counterintelligence Field Activity, or related agencies with regard to the Threat and Local Observation Notice reports; and (2) the legal authority serving as the basis for the National Security Agency (NSA) or DOD to conduct surveillance and gather counterterrorism intelligence within the United States without warrants.

bill.title: Requesting the President and directing the Secretary of Defense to transmit to the House of Representatives all information in the possession of the President or the Secretary of Defense relating to the collection of intelligence information pertaining to persons inside the United States without obtaining court-ordered warrants authorizing the collection of such information and relating to the policy of the United States with respect to the gathering of counterterrorism intelligence within the United States.

item.title: Requesting the President and directing the Secretary of Defense to transmit to the House of Representatives all information in the possession of the President or the Secretary of Defense relating to the collection of intelligence information pertaining to persons inside the United States without obtaining court-ordered warrants authorizing the collection of such information and relating to the policy of the United States with respect to the gathering of counterterrorism intelligence within the United States.

Requesting the President and directing the Secretary of Defense to transmit to the House of Representatives all information in the possession of the President or the Secretary of Defense relating to the collection of intelligence information pertaining to persons inside the United States without obtaining court-ordered warrants authorizing the collection of such information and relating to the policy of the United States with respect to the gathering of counterterrorism intelligence within the United States.

latestAction.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 151.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
